properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters from Port Fourchon Louisiana to Lower Atchafalaya River LA from 20 to 60 NM
properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued February 6 at 2:57AM CST until February 6 at 4:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans LA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a

* Special Marine Warning for...
Coastal waters from Port Fourchon Louisiana to Lower Atchafalaya
River LA from 20 to 60 NM...

* Until 400 AM CST.

* At 256 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing
waterspouts was located 7 nm southeast of Ship Shoal 295, or 58 nm
southwest of Isle Derniers, moving northeast at 50 knots.

HAZARD...Waterspouts, wind gusts 34 knots or greater, and large
hail.

SOURCE...Radar.

IMPACT...Waterspouts can quickly form and capsize boats...damage
vessels and oil rigs...and create suddenly higher waves.
Make sure all on board are in a secure location and
wearing life jackets. Expect wind gusts in excess of 34
knots and suddenly higher waves. Boats could sustain
damage or capsize. Make sure all on board are wearing
life jackets. Large hail could result in injury and
damage to boats...vessels and oil rigs.

* The severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly open waters.
properties.instruction: Move to safe harbor until hazardous weather passes.
